body:
when i watch the world burn

a chaptered fic, inspired by the album “doom days” by bastille

summary: The world is ending in six hours, how do the GHC and friends manage and cope?

word count of chapter: 1,176

(tw: mentions of underage drinking and existentialism/death)

previous chapter

—————————

chapter 2: bad decisions

“and we’ll make the same mistakes ‘til the morning breaks”

The six kids decided to trek down to the lake to take it all in and try to relax for a moment, as downtown had rapidly gotten super overcrowded as the news spread out.

Buffy pulled Andi off to the side as they walked down. “Why is he here?” She asked, tilting her head at TJ.

“I asked Amber to come down, and she didn’t want to leave her brother behind. It’s the end of the world, Buff, you’re really gonna hold on to some petty grudge?” Andi retorted.

Cyrus turned his head around while he continued walking in front of them. “I can hear you, by the way, and I’m still talking to him, too. It was his idea to meet up, anyway, not mine. I’m trying to let it go, why can’t you?”

Buffy just sighed and not-so-subtly rolled her eyes. “At least Kira isn’t here,” she said, maybe a little louder than intended.

“I know, right? Thank god she’s finally not clinging on to me,” TJ joined in on the complaining, while Amber laughed next to him.

Cyrus’ eyebrows furrowed. “What?”

“Uh, I-uh, I’ll just talk to you about it later?” TJ stuttered out.

Cyrus squinted but nodded, as they arrived at the lake. Luckily enough, there was barely anyone there. Everyone was probably with their families, at least that’s why all jobs had been closed down. (For the last time.)

They all sat down on the grass, the cooling ground soothing them all just the slightest bit. “You can kinda see it,” Jonah said, looking up at the stars.

“Where?” Andi asked, squinting.

“See the little star bigger than the rest of them? That’s it, I think,” he replied, pointing at the asteroid.

“That’s what’s gonna kill us, then,” TJ mumbled.

“I guess it all never really mattered, huh?” Amber chimed in after a few moments.

“What do you mean?” Jonah asked.

“Well, I mean, no matter how good we all were, no matter how much we all tried to do our best at things, we still are gonna end up not doing the best we ever could’ve done. We don’t get to live. It’s over,” she ranted.

“That’s true. I mean, the world still sucks, what with all the climate issues, and bigotry and everything everywhere, but it doesn’t matter now, I guess. It’s all gonna be gone,” Andi added on.

“Hey,” Buffy joined in, snapping them all out of their stupor, “yeah, that all might be true. But up to this point, we’ve been living our lives the best we could, right? Regardless of circumstances, we were all getting to a pretty great place, right? And we still have a little under six hours to do almost anything we’ve ever wanted with no consequences.”

“No consequences… that’s it!” Cyrus exclaimed, standing up. “We are not gonna just sit here and wallow in self-pity. We’re gonna celebrate the lives we did lead and party the hardest that anyone ever has!”

“Are you sure that’s a good idea?” Buffy asked, standing up next to him.

“I’m up for it,” TJ added, also standing, thus making the rest of the group get up in agreement.

“So, how are we doing this, then?”

•••

Four boxes of fireworks, two carts of food, and three raided department stores later, the group decided to head to the park for their party. (They didn’t want to ruin the peacefulness of the lake, probably one of the last calm places still around.)

“Hey, none of our parents are here, right?” Amber called out.

“No, why?” Andi replied, connecting her phone to a bluetooth speaker.

“Amber, you’ve got to be kidding me,” TJ could be heard scolding her, as she stood holding up a small box of beers. “You realize we’re all only 16, right?”

“You all are, I’m not,” she replied, sitting down on the grass. “We’re all dying today, anyway.”

“This is a horrible idea,” he muttered, making his way over to Buffy and Cyrus.

“She’s got a point, Teej,” Cyrus gestured over to her.

“Cyrus!” Buffy exclaimed.

“What? We haven’t lived, and like you said, we’ve got six hours to do whatever we want,” he said, walking over to Amber.

“That’s not what I meant and you know it!” Buffy called after him, but he dismissed her with a wave of his hand. She rolled her eyes, looking to TJ. “How’ve you been? You’ve been awfully distant for the past year and a half,” she questioned, the ever-sarcastic tone to her voice evident.

“I’ve been okay,” TJ answered, ignoring her sardonic comment. “Cyrus and I’ve been back on speaking terms for a few months, so I’ve been better lately.”

Buffy quirked an eyebrow. “You know, he never did tell us quite what happened on Costume Day. Why’d you ditch?” she asked, grabbing a soda from a nearby cooler.

TJ hesitated. “I didn’t actually tell him the whole story, so that makes sense.”

Buffy rolled her eyes. “Sounds about right. Leave it to you to half-ass an apology to someone who means a lot to you.”

“Hey, I had a good reason,” TJ defended.

She crossed her arms, soda forgotten. “And what would that be?”

Tj sighed, then whispered, “If I tell you, you have to promise not to tell anyone else. Including Cyrus. Amber is the only one who knows about it, okay?”

“Okay,” Buffy replied, but it came out more like a question as TJ grabbed her wrist and brought her over to sit down at the picnic table nearby.

TJ starts, taking a deep breath, “The day before Costume Day, Kira came up to me and asked if I wanted to do a costume with her, but I turned her down. Three times, actually, she kept persisting with it. Finally, she goes, ‘So you’d rather do a costume with Cyrus than with me? Have fun with that.’ She said it like something was wrong with it, like she was implying that… that it was bad I would want to do a costume with a boy.”

“Oh… my god. What a bitch,” Buffy gritted through her teeth.

“Yeah. She kept manipulating me every time I’d want to talk to him or any of you guys, saying that people could tell, so eventually, over the course of the past two years, she became somewhat of a safety blanket since no one would, you know, suspect anything if I was with her,” he continued. “So, basically, I fucked everything up.”

“Hey,” Buffy said, strong and sure, but then again, when wasn’t she? She leaned forward, elbows on her knees. “You did not fuck anything up. Cyrus is talking to you, yeah? And Kira isn’t here. You can still fix things, TJ.”

“Not while he’s tipsy,” he added, gesturing over to the brunette who was dancing and laughing with Amber.

“Give him a few minutes, he’ll be fine.” She paused. “And maybe take the drinks away from him.”

A yell across the small field from Andi sounded as she started the music, “Let’s get this apocalyptic party started!”

—————————

summary: how do i summon canadians to my profile? because i’m tired of always being left out as soon as something American or British is...
body:
how do i summon canadians to my profile?

summary: I just went to the most enjoyable wedding ever and you know what that means...
body:
I just went to the most enjoyable wedding ever and you know what that means…

Tyrus wedding Headcanons:

  • TJ had to ask for permission from all 4 of Cyrus’s parents… and Andi and Buffy. Buffy said no the first three times (honestly, she just thought they were too young).
  • Cyrus’s wedding ring is thin, white gold with regular notches all around the circumference. TJ’s is thicker, rose gold with a geodesic design and matte finish.
  • Jonah almost loses the rings.
  • Andi ends up arguing so often with the wedding planner hired by Cy’s parents that eventually she just takes over the position by force.
  • Buffy is Cyrus’s best woman, and she takes the responsibility way too seriously.
  • Cyrus’s huge family really strains the budget. There wasn’t much of his family that TJ was willing to invite but he filled his side with dozens of college friends that were his found family.
  • TJ’s vows include the line, “You’re still the only person I can talk to like this, but you’re also the reason I feel comfortable declaring my love for you in front of all these people. You’ve helped my grow into the man I am. For that, you deserve the world, and I promise to do everything I can for the rest of my life to give it to you.”
  • Cyrus is terrified to read his vows, and definitely cries a few tears of happiness while delivering them.
  • TJ can’t help himself and kisses Cyrus before the officiant finishes saying ‘you may now kiss each other’
  • Cyrus practiced dancing for the ‘first dance’ as often as possible with anyone who would humor him in the week leading up to the event. Which mostly meant Jonah and Andi, every time he saw them.
  • Buffy’s ‘Best Woman’ toast is only about a minute long but it’s still able to bring tears to everyone’s eyes—which was exactly her goal. Short but effective.
  • Chocolate chocolate-chip wedding cake.
  • Honeymoon trip to Europe, and TJ gets incredibly bad food poisoning on their second day in France. Turns out seeing his husband sick in a hospital bed just makes Cyrus love him even more.
  • It takes ten years for the truth to come out: the two of them got so stressed about planning the wedding that, six months before the ceremony, they went and got secretly married at the courthouse. It helped them remember what was important to them, and it kept Cyrus from literally falling apart.
